LayoutNode.Content: INTERNET SERVICES How to enable Gmail's SmartCompose feature Hate writing emails? Us too. BY JASON CIPRIANI | MAY 14, 2018 1:35 PM PDT
LayoutNode.SRC:
Internet Services

How to enable Gmail's Smart Compose feature

Hate writing emails? Us too.

by Jason Cipriani| May 14, 20181:35 PM PDT

LayoutNode.Content: features too. There's a new offline mode , a new tool for sending self-destructing messages, and Smart Replies.
LayoutNode.SRC: features too. There's a new offline mode, a new tool for sendingself-destructing messages, and Smart Replies.

LayoutNode.Content: Compose feature at Google I/O last week. The feature was promised to launch in the coming days and weeks, but if you don't feel like waiting for an official release, you can enable it right now.
LayoutNode.SRC: Compose feature at Google I/O last week. The feature was promised tolaunch in the coming days and weeks, but if you don't feel like waiting for anofficial release, you can enable it right now.

LayoutNode.Content: Watch this: Smart Compose will write your emails for you in Gmail
LayoutNode.SRC: Watch this:Smart Compose will write your emails for you in Gmail

LayoutNode.Content: What is Smart Compose?
LayoutNode.SRC: What is Smart Compose?

LayoutNode.Content: Smart Compose uses AI to guess what you're going to type before you typeit. It bases some of this on the recipient and email subject, as well as yourtypical writing habits. So if you compose an email with a subject of "Dinnerplans this weekend?" Smart Compose will take that into account as youbegin typing and suggest the kind of things people write when arranging ameal.
LayoutNode.SRC: Smart Compose uses AI to guess what you're going to type before you type it. It bases some of this on the recipient and email subject, as well as your typical writing habits. So if you compose an email with a subject of "Dinner plans this weekend?" Smart Compose will take that into account as you begin typing and suggest the kind of things people write when arranging a meal.

LayoutNode.Content: How to get it
LayoutNode.SRC: How to get it

LayoutNode.Content: Screenshot by Jason Cipriani/CNET
LayoutNode.SRC: Screenshot by Jason Cipriani/CNET

LayoutNode.Content: your Gmail settings page. You have to be using the new Gmail design for Experimental Access to be an option.
LayoutNode.SRC: your Gmail settings page. You have to be using the new Gmail design forExperimental Access to be an option.

LayoutNode.Content: Click on the Settings gear then select Settings . Under the General tab, find and enable Experimental Access .
LayoutNode.SRC: Click on the Settings gear then select Settings. Under the General tab, findand enable Experimental Access.

LayoutNode.Content: I had to close my browser and sign back into Gmail before Smart Composewould start working. If you don't have access right away, be patient and itwill eventually show up.
LayoutNode.SRC: I had to close my browser and sign back into Gmail before Smart Compose would start working. If you don't have access right away, be patient and it will eventually show up.

LayoutNode.Content: Type then Tab
LayoutNode.SRC: Type then Tab

LayoutNode.Content: Jason Cipriani/CNET
LayoutNode.SRC: Jason Cipriani/CNET

LayoutNode.Content: So how do you use Smart Compose? It's pretty easy. Just start typing. Asyou type, you'll see slightly transparent text to the right of your cursor. If thistext matches what you want to say, just hit the Tab key and it will fill it in foryou.
LayoutNode.SRC: So how do you use Smart Compose? It's pretty easy. Just start typing. As you type, you'll see slightly transparent text to the right of your cursor. If this text matches what you want to say, just hit the Tab key and it will fill it in for you.

LayoutNode.Content: If not, keep typing and Smart Compose will continue to make suggestions asyou go.
LayoutNode.SRC: If not, keep typing and Smart Compose will continue to make suggestions as you go.

LayoutNode.Content: Right now, the feature isn't nearly as impressive as what Google showed offon stage last week, but it's a start. Hopefully it will eventually cut back on theamount of time you spend typing out mundane emails.
LayoutNode.SRC: Right now, the feature isn't nearly as impressive as what Google showed off on stage last week, but it's a start. Hopefully it will eventually cut back on the amount of time you spend typing out mundane emails.
